intro: Appendicula recondita, commonly known as the hidden appendicula, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that range in color from pale pink to deep red. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It is noted for its unique floral structure, which includes a prominent appendage at the base of the corolla. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Appendicula recondita is considered a rare and endangered species.
